SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENABLEMENT SITES (MYTRAILHEAD)
Brand Your Enablement Site

When you configure your enablement site, you can apply your company’s visual identity, such as logo, primary color, and banner image. You can also customize the links that appear in the footer of each page. And you can designate the pages where your users land when they log out or click the Help icon. These customizations persist across your enablement site.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions


USER ROLES
This topic supports these enablement site roles:	Salesforce Admins
Customize the Logo or Today Page Banner
Style your company’s enablement site with a logo and banner image. The logo appears at the top of every page, while the banner appears across the top of the Today page.
Add Your Brand Color
When you choose your brand color, Trailmaker adjusts the color as necessary for accessibility and legibility. The page header text is white and gray. We recommend not using white, yellow, or another pale hue for your brand color. Select a darker color for text to make it more readable.
Customize the URLs for the Help and Logout Landing Pages
You can direct your enablement site users to your own help site, instead of Salesforce Help, when they click the help icon. And when your users log out of your enablement site, you can designate the page where they land.
Customize the Links in Your Enablement Site Page Footer
You can display links that are relevant to your company and your users in the page footer on your enablement site. Include links to your company’s Experience Cloud site, privacy statement, terms of service—whatever you like. You can designate up to three custom links.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Brand Your Enablement Site
